title: My medical insurance site won't let me log in. I set ghostery to trust site, cleared recent history
content: bold text Firefox won't let me sign in to my health insurance account. I cleared cache, set ghostery to trust site, changed password. The agent had no problem getting on my account with Chrome. I finally accessed through Ipad, but I still cannot get on with Firefox. Says, "Unable to retrieve information" and tells me to contact the company.
creator: gpetter

title: Firefox says can't start another version is running
content:
My Wife's computer - still on Windows 10 - says it can't start Firefox as it is still running, hitting the "close Firefox now" button just returns us to the same screen. I tried to uninstall and reinstall Firefox it tried to do a "reinstall" it says her profile is no longer available, while inconvenient she still should be able to start it up, but it still gives me the same message. that it is still running and needs closed. Trying to "close it doesn't do anything. I have restarted several times and even did a shut down and restart. Nothing seems to work. I assume some "stub" of Firefox is out there in the system/cache making Firefox think it is is still active but I can't find it to shut it down. Where do I need to go to "end task" on this phantom Firefox?

Other information: 1. We have Norton Security software installed, if that matters. 2. The same seems to happening to Thunderbird, but maybe I need to go to another help forum for that? 3. I am entering this issue from my computer that seems to be just fine with Firefox, so can't send browser data as it is irrelevant to the issue (it's on a different computer and install instance.
creator: fhblists

title: Firefox Color
content: I managed to change colors of almost everything in my firefox browser but despite selecting dark mode and trying all different options in firefox color, all the menus just refuse to not be white. So my question is how can I change color of all the menus (file, history etc.) to be anything other than white?
creator: emilek16-95

title: Certain fonts are squished/blurry compared to Chrome
content: I'm looking to switch over from Chrome to Firefox, and most elements are smooth and easy, but certain text lines appear slightly compressed, blurrier, or with reduced kerning — not enough to make them illegible, but just enough to cause eye strain for me. I've tried multiple solutions I've found online, including adjusting Firefox settings like gfx.font_rendering.cleartype_params.contrast and related options, and nothing has seemed to help. Disallowing websites from using their own fonts helps, but I would rather not have to use that setting. Any possible fixes?
creator: reintegrationtablet

title: Gnome scaling: pasted screenshots from clipboard are twice bigger.
content:
Hello, I'm suffering from an annoyance: having 200% Gnome interface scaling (with or without fractional scaling enabled), when pasting a screenshot from clipboard to some image accepting forms, like on forums, it appears twice bigger than the source. The same screenshot pasted to GIMP looks correct.

Chrome behaves similarly, btw. So what could that be?

title: TDeasy web keeps putting me back to the login screen.  This is new since their December software update.

I am running Ubuntu 22 on a desktop and a laptop with Firefox 121 64bit. I have contacted TD regarding this and the solution suggested was to use a difference browser or disable all the extensions and try again. Does anybody know a REAL fix for this?The problem seems to be fixed if the "delete Cookies" extension is disabled

title: history no recording all pages
content:
Been using firefox since it came out. Now on my phone i notice it doesnt record my full browsing history.

I'll be watching a video on youtube and occasionally accidentally close the tab to the video im watching. I go to open the history because "reopen closed tab" isnt an option on my phone and cant find the video i was just halfway through watching.

If i open my firefox history it shows only 3 videos under 'today' yet when going to youtube watch history it shows 7. Two of those 3 were the ones that autoplayed after i fell asleep.

I went to the second video on my youtube history and opened up firefox history and its still not there.

title: Firefox Sync password merge policy
content:
Good day and happy new year,

I would appreciate some details about Firefox Sync policy with logins when it comes to conflicts between different devices.

A practical example: a computer which was being synced asked me to login again, maybe because of a password change, or some problems after updating.

While syncing was not working, some logins had been deleted/updated locally.

In this case are local changes uploaded, do they get overwritten by remote data, or in case of conflict the user is asked to choose? Does Firefox in general automatically choose to keep the most recent changes when merging logins, or not?

Many thanks and regards
